name: Path of the Berserker
description: Barbarians who walk the Path of the Berserker direct their Rage primarily toward violence. Their path is one of untrammeled fury, and they thrill in the chaos of battle as they allow their Rage to seize and empower them.

features.name: Frenzy
features.description: If you use Reckless Attack while your Rage is active, you deal extra damage to the first target you hit on your turn with a Strength-based attack. To determine the extra damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. The damage has the same type as the weapon or Unarmed Strike used for the attack.

features.name: Mindless Rage
features.description: You have Immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions while your Rage is active. If you're Charmed or Frightened when you enter your Rage, the condition ends on you.

features.name: Retaliation
features.description: When you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to make one melee attack against that creature using a weapon or Unarmed Strike.

features.name: Intimidating Presence
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can strike terror into others with your menacing presence and primal power. When you do so, each creature of your choice in a 30-foot Emanation originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, a creature has the Frightened condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the Frightened creature's turns, the creature repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest unless you expend a use of your Rage (no action required) to restore your use of it.

name: Path of the Wild Heart
description: Many barbarians feel a kinship with wild animals and the untamed wilderness. The Path of the Wild Heart allows you to channel the primal spirits of nature, gaining supernatural senses and abilities that link you to the beasts of the world.

features.name: Animal Speaker
features.description: You can cast Beast Sense and Speak with Animals as Rituals, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability for them.

features.name: Rage of the Wilds
features.description: When you activate your Rage, you choose one of these effects: Bear (you gain Resistance to every damage type except Force, Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant), Eagle (you can Disengage and Dash as part of the Bonus Action to enter your Rage, and as a Bonus Action on subsequent turns while raging), or Wolf (your allies have Advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of you).

features.name: Aspect of the Wilds
features.description: You gain a magical aspect of a wild animal of your choice: Owl (Darkvision 60 feet), Panther (climbing speed equal to walking speed), or Salmon (swimming speed equal to walking speed). You can change your choice when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Nature Speaker
features.description: You can cast Commune with Nature, only as a Ritual.

features.name: Power of the Wilds
features.description: Whenever you activate your Rage, you gain one of the following options of your choice: Falcon (while your Rage is active, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed if you aren't wearing any armor), Lion (while your Rage is active, any of your enemies within 5 feet of you have Disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you or another Barbarian who has this option active), or Ram (while your Rage is active, you can cause a Large or smaller creature to have the Prone condition when you hit it with a melee attack).

name: Path of the World Tree
description: Barbarians who follow the Path of the World Tree connect with the cosmic tree Yggdrasil through their rage. This connection allows them to transport foes and allies using the tree's branches, and to draw on the life force that flows through its roots.

features.name: Vitality of the Tree
features.description: When your Rage starts, you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Barbarian level. While your Rage is active, at the start of each of your turns you can give one creature within 10 feet Temporary HP by rolling a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus.

features.name: Branches of the Tree
features.description: While raging, if a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to force it to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, you teleport it to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of you. The space must be on a surface or liquid that can support the creature.

features.name: Battering Roots
features.description: While raging, your reach with melee weapons that have the Heavy or Versatile property increases by 10 feet. In addition, when you hit a creature with such a weapon, you can activate an additional Push or Topple mastery property (even if you've already used a mastery property this turn).

features.name: Travel Along the Tree
features.description: While raging, you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see as a Bonus Action (once per turn). Once per Rage, when you teleport this way, you can bring up to 6 willing creatures within 10 feet, teleporting them to unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of your destination.

name: Path of the Zealot
description: Some deities inspire their followers to pitch themselves into a ferocious battle fury. These barbarians are zealots -- warriors who channel their rage into powerful displays of divine power. A variety of gods across the worlds of D&D inspire their followers to embrace this path.

features.name: Divine Fury
features.description: The first creature you hit on each turn with a weapon attack takes extra damage of 1d6 + half your Barbarian level. The damage is Necrotic or Radiant (you choose each time you deal this damage).

features.name: Warrior of the Gods
features.description: You have a pool of d12s for self-healing, starting with 4 dice. As a Bonus Action while raging, you can expend dice from this pool, rolling them and regaining HP equal to the total. Your pool increases: 5 dice at 6th level, 6 at 12th, 7 at 17th. You regain all dice on a Long Rest.

features.name: Fanatical Focus
features.description: Once per active Rage, if you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and you must use the new roll.

features.name: Zealous Presence
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you unleash a battle cry. Up to 10 creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you gain Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Rage of the Gods
features.description: While raging, you gain a Fly Speed equal to your Speed, Resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage, and when an ally you can see within 30 feet is reduced to 0 HP, you can use your Reaction to let them drop to a number of Hit Points equal to your Barbarian level instead. You can use this Reaction once per Rage.

name: College of Dance
description: Bards of the College of Dance know that the Words of Creation can't be experienced only through speech and song; they are also expressed through motion. These bards practice a dazzling style of combat in which their martial artistry is indistinguishable from their spellcasting.

features.name: Dazzling Footwork
features.description:
You gain proficiency in Performance if you don't already have it and have Advantage on any Performance check involving dancing. While not wearing armor or wielding a Shield, your AC equals 10 + DEX + CHA. You can use Dexterity for Unarmed Strikes, dealing Bludgeoning damage equal to your Bardic Inspiration die + DEX. When you take the Attack action and hit with an Unarmed Strike, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until end of turn and the target can't make Opportunity Attacks against you for rest of turn.

Agile Strikes. When you expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration as part of an action, a Bonus Action, or a Reaction, you can make one Unarmed Strike as part of that action, Bonus Action, or Reaction.

features.name: Inspiring Movement
features.description: When an enemy you can see ends its turn within 5 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to expend one use of Bardic Inspiration, choosing an ally you can see within 30 feet of you. That ally can use its Reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Tandem Footwork
features.description: When you roll Initiative, you can expend one use of Bardic Inspiration. When you do, choose a number of creatures within 30 feet of you equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Each creature rolls a Bardic Inspiration die and adds the number rolled to its Initiative.

features.name: Leading Evasion
features.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed, and only half damage if you fail. Creatures within 5 feet of you making the same Dexterity saving throw also benefit from this feature.

name: College of Glamour
description: The College of Glamour is the home of bards who mastered their craft in the vibrant realm of the Feywild or under the tutelage of someone who dwelled there. Tutored by satyrs, eladrin, and other fey, these bards learn to use their magic to delight and captivate others.

features.name: Mantle of Inspiration
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one use of Bardic Inspiration to give yourself a wondrous appearance. When you do so, choose a number of creatures you can see within 60 feet of you equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Each gains Temporary Hit Points equal to twice the number rolled on your Bardic Inspiration die and can immediately use its Reaction to move up to its speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Beguiling Magic
features.description: You always have Charm Person and Mirror Image prepared and they don't count against spells known. When you cast an Enchantment or Illusion spell using a spell slot, you can cause one target of the spell to make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, the target has the Charmed or Frightened condition (your choice) for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at end of each of its turns. You can also restore this use by expending one use of your Bardic Inspiration (no action required).

features.name: Mantle of Majesty
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you take on an appearance of unearthly beauty for 1 minute. For the duration, you can cast Command as a Bonus Action on each of your turns without expending a spell slot. A creature Charmed by you automatically fails its saving throw against the Command. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also restore this use by expending a spell slot of 3rd level or higher (no action required).

features.name: Unbreakable Majesty
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you assume a magically majestic presence for 1 minute. For the duration, whenever any creature tries to attack you for the first time on a turn, the attacker must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the attack misses you. On a success, it can attack you normally. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.

name: College of Lore
description: Bards of the College of Lore know something about most things, collecting bits of knowledge from sources as diverse as scholarly tomes and peasant tales. Whether singing folk ballads in taverns or elaborate compositions in royal courts, these bards use their gifts to hold audiences spellbound.

features.name: Bonus Proficiencies
features.description: When you join the College of Lore at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with three skills of your choice.

features.name: Cutting Words
features.description: You learn to use your wit to supernaturally distract, confuse, and otherwise sap the confidence and competence of others. When a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you makes a damage roll or succeeds on an ability check or attack roll, you can use your Reaction to expend one use of Bardic Inspiration, rolling your Bardic Inspiration die and subtracting the number rolled from the creature's roll, reducing the damage or potentially turning the success into a failure.

features.name: Magical Discoveries
features.description: You learn two spells of your choice. These spells can come from the Cleric, Druid, or Wizard spell list or any combination thereof. A spell you choose must be a cantrip or a spell for which you have spell slots, as shown in the Bard Features table. You always have the chosen spells prepared, and whenever you gain a Bard level, you can replace one of the spells with another spell that meets these requirements.

features.name: Peerless Skill
features.description: Starting at 14th level, when you make an ability check or attack roll and fail, you can expend one use of Bardic Inspiration, rolling the Bardic Inspiration die and adding the number rolled to your roll, potentially turning a failure into a success. If the roll still fails, the Bardic Inspiration isn't expended.

name: College of Valor
description: Bards of the College of Valor are daring skalds whose tales keep alive the memory of the great heroes of the past, and thereby inspire a new generation of heroes. These bards gather in mead halls or around great bonfires to sing the deeds of the mighty, both past and present.

features.name: Combat Inspiration
features.description: You learn to inspire others in battle. A creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you can roll that die and add the number rolled to a damage roll it just made. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the creature, it can use its Reaction to roll the Bardic Inspiration die and add the number rolled to its AC against that attack.

features.name: Martial Training
features.description: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Medium Armor and Shields. In addition, you can use a Simple or Martial weapon as a Spellcasting Focus to cast spells from your Bard spell list.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. In addition, you can cast one of your Bard cantrips that has a casting time of an action in place of one of those attacks.

features.name: Battle Magic
features.description: When you use your action to cast a Bard spell, you can make one weapon attack or an Unarmed Strike as a Bonus Action.

name: Life Domain
description: The Life Domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy that sustains all life. Clerics who tap into this domain are master healers, channeling divine power to cure wounds, restore vitality, and bolster the living against the forces of death.

features.name: Life Domain Spells
features.description: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. 3rd level: Aid, Bless, Cure Wounds, Lesser Restoration. 5th level: Mass Healing Word, Revivify. 7th level: Aura of Life, Death Ward. 9th level: Greater Restoration, Mass Cure Wounds. These spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.

features.name: Disciple of Life
features.description: When a spell you cast with a spell slot restores Hit Points to a creature, that creature regains additional Hit Points on the turn you cast the spell. The additional Hit Points equal 2 plus the spell slot's level.

features.name: Preserve Life
features.description: As a Magic action, you present your Holy Symbol and expend a use of your Channel Divinity to evoke healing energy that can restore a number of Hit Points equal to five times your Cleric level. Choose Bloodied creatures within 30 feet of yourself (which can include you), and divide those Hit Points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half its Hit Point maximum.

features.name: Blessed Healer
features.description: The healing spells you cast on others heal you as well. Immediately after you cast a spell with a spell slot that restores Hit Points to one or more creatures other than yourself, you regain Hit Points equal to 2 plus the spell slot's level.

features.name: Supreme Healing
features.description: When you would normally roll one or more dice to restore Hit Points to a creature with a spell or Channel Divinity, don't roll those dice for the healing; instead use the highest number possible for each die. For example, instead of restoring 2d6 Hit Points to a creature with a spell, you restore 12.

name: Light Domain
description: Gods of light promote the ideals of rebirth, truth, vigilance, and beauty, often using the symbol of the sun. Clerics of the Light Domain are enlightened souls infused with radiance and the power of their gods' discerning vision, charged with chasing away lies and burning away darkness.

features.name: Light Domain Spells
features.description: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Light Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared: 3rd level -- Burning Hands, Faerie Fire, Scorching Ray, See Invisibility; 5th level -- Daylight, Fireball; 7th level -- Arcane Eye, Wall of Fire; 9th level -- Flame Strike, Scrying.

features.name: Warding Flare
features.description: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, you can use your Reaction to impose Disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before the attacker. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Radiance of the Dawn
features.description: As a Magic action, you present your Holy Symbol and any magical darkness within 30 feet of you is dispelled. Each hostile creature within 30 feet must make a Constitution saving throw, taking Radiant damage equal to 2d10 + your Cleric level on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

features.name: Improved Warding Flare
features.description: You regain all expended uses of your Warding Flare when you finish a Short or Long Rest. In addition, whenever you use Warding Flare, you can give the target of the triggering attack a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to 2d6 plus your Wisdom modifier.

features.name: Corona of Light
features.description: As a Magic action, you activate an aura of sunlight that lasts for 1 minute. You emit Bright Light in a 60-foot radius and Dim Light 30 feet beyond that. Your enemies in the Bright Light have Disadvantage on saving throws against any spell that deals Fire or Radiant damage.

name: Trickery Domain
description: Gods of trickery are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among both gods and mortals. Clerics of this domain are a disruptive force in the world, puncturing pride, mocking tyrants, and stealing from the rich to give to the poor.

features.name: Trickery Domain Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Charm Person, Disguise Self; 5th level -- Mirror Image, Pass without Trace; 7th level -- Hypnotic Pattern, Nondetection; 9th level -- Confusion, Dimension Door.

features.name: Blessing of the Trickster
features.description: As a Magic action, you can touch a willing creature (including yourself) to give it Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. This blessing lasts until your next Long Rest. No concentration required.

features.name: Invoke Duplicity
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute. The illusion appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. As a Bonus Action, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet. You can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space. When both you and your illusion are within 5 feet of a creature, you have Advantage on attack rolls against it.

features.name: Trickster's Transposition
features.description: You can teleport, swapping places with your illusory duplicate as a Bonus Action. You can also dismiss the duplicate and teleport to its space.

features.name: Improved Duplicity
features.description: You can create up to three duplicates instead of one when you use Invoke Duplicity. When a duplicate disappears, each creature of your choice within 5 feet of the duplicate regains HP equal to your Cleric level.

name: War Domain
description: War has many manifestations. It can make heroes of ordinary people. It can be desperate and horrific, with acts of cruelty and cowardice eclipsing instances of excellence and courage. Clerics of the War Domain excel in battle, inspiring others to fight the good fight.

features.name: War Domain Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Divine Favor, Shield of Faith; 5th level -- Magic Weapon, Spiritual Weapon; 7th level -- Crusader's Mantle, Spirit Guardians; 9th level -- Freedom of Movement, Stoneskin.

features.name: War Priest
features.description: Your god delivers bolts of inspiration to you while you are engaged in battle. When you use the Attack action, you can make one weapon attack or Unarmed Strike as a Bonus Action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Short or Long Rest.

features.name: Guided Strike
features.description: When you make an attack roll, you can grant a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses. Alternatively, when an ally within 30 feet makes an attack roll, you can use your Reaction to grant that ally a +10 bonus to the roll.

features.name: War God's Blessing
features.description: You can cast Shield of Faith or Spiritual Weapon without a spell slot, without Concentration, lasting 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Avatar of Battle
features.description: You gain Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

name: Circle of the Land
description: The Circle of the Land is made up of mystics and sages who safeguard ancient knowledge and rites through a vast oral tradition. These druids draw on the magic of the environment where they were initiated and gain the ability to prepare a broader range of druidic magic.

features.name: Circle of the Land Spells
features.description: Whenever you finish a Long Rest, choose one type of land: Arid, Polar, Temperate, or Tropical. Consult the associated list of spells for your chosen land. You always have those spells prepared, and they don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.

features.name: Land's Aid
features.description: As a Magic action, you can expend a use of Wild Shape and choose a point within 60 feet. Vitality-giving flowers and life-draining thorns appear for a moment in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each creature of your choice in that area must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, taking 2d6 Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. One creature of your choice in that area also regains 2d6 Hit Points. The damage and healing increase to 3d6 at 10th level and 4d6 at 14th level.

features.name: Natural Recovery
features.description: You can cast one of the spells from your Circle Spells feature without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a Long Rest before you can do so again. In addition, when you finish a Short Rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your Druid level (round up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher. Once you use this Short Rest recovery, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Nature's Ward
features.description: You are immune to the Poisoned condition. In addition, you gain Resistance to a damage type determined by the land you chose for your Circle Spells: Arid — Fire, Polar — Cold, Temperate — Lightning, Tropical — Poison.

features.name: Nature's Sanctuary
features.description: As a Magic action, you can expend a use of Wild Shape and cause spectral trees and vines to appear in a 15-foot Cube on a point you can see within 120 feet. The area counts as Half Cover, and each ally in the area gains the benefit of your Nature's Ward damage resistance. You can move the Cube up to 60 feet as a Bonus Action on your turn. The Cube lasts for 1 minute or until you lose Concentration (as if concentrating on a spell).

name: Circle of the Moon
description: Druids of the Circle of the Moon are fierce guardians of the wilds. Their order gathers under the full moon to share news and trade warnings. They haunt the deepest parts of the wilderness, where they might go for weeks on end before crossing paths with another humanoid creature.

features.name: Circle Forms
features.description: You can channel lunar magic when you assume a Wild Shape form. The maximum CR for the form equals your Druid level divided by 3 (round down). Your AC equals 13 plus your Wisdom modifier if that total is higher than the beast's AC. You gain Temporary Hit Points equal to three times your Druid level.

features.name: Circle of the Moon Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared and can cast them while in Wild Shape form. 3rd level -- Cure Wounds, Moonbeam, Starry Wisp; 5th level -- Conjure Animals; 7th level -- Fount of Moonlight; 9th level -- Mass Cure Wounds.

features.name: Improved Circle Forms
features.description: While in a Wild Shape form, each of your attacks can deal its normal damage type or Radiant damage (your choice each time you hit). You can also add your Wisdom modifier to your Constitution saving throws.

features.name: Moonlight Step
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You have Advantage on the next attack roll you make before the end of the turn. Uses equal proficiency bonus per Long Rest.

features.name: Lunar Form
features.description: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack in Wild Shape, you can deal an extra 2d10 Radiant damage.

name: Circle of the Sea
description: Druids of the Circle of the Sea draw on the power of the ocean and its creatures. Their tradition carries the bytes of ancient ocean songs, and they feel the pull of tides in their magic. They are found wherever coastlines meet deep waters, guarding the mysterious depths.

features.name: Wrath of the Sea
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you conjure oceanic energy around you in a 10-foot Emanation that lasts until the start of your next turn. When you create the Emanation or as a Bonus Action on subsequent turns, choose another creature you can see in the Emanation. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or take Cold or Lightning damage (your choice) equal to 1d6 rolled a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once). On a success, the target takes half damage. You can also push the target up to 15 feet away from you on a failed save.

features.name: Circle of the Sea Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Fog Cloud, Gust of Wind, Ray of Frost, Shatter, Thunderwave; 5th level -- Lightning Bolt, Water Breathing; 7th level -- Control Water, Ice Storm; 9th level -- Conjure Elemental, Hold Monster.

features.name: Aquatic Affinity
features.description: The size of the Emanation created by your Wrath of the Sea increases to 15 feet. You also gain a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

features.name: Stormborn
features.description: You gain a Fly Speed equal to your Walking Speed while Wrath of the Sea is active. You also gain Resistance to Cold, Lightning, and Thunder damage.

features.name: Oceanic Gift
features.description: While Wrath of the Sea is active, you can have the Emanation manifest around a willing creature within 60 feet instead of yourself. You can expend two uses of Wild Shape to manifest it around both yourself and the creature simultaneously.

name: Circle of the Stars
description: Druids of the Circle of the Stars have tracked heavenly patterns since time immemorial, discovering secrets hidden amid the constellations. By revealing and understanding these secrets, the Circle of the Stars seeks to harness the powers of the cosmos.

features.name: Star Map
features.description: You've created a star chart as part of your study of the heavens. The star chart is a Tiny object that serves as your spellcasting focus. While holding it, you can cast Guidance and Guiding Bolt without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Starry Form
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can expend a use of Wild Shape to take on a starry form for 10 minutes. Choose one constellation: Archer (luminous arrow attacks for 1d8 + WIS Radiant as a Bonus Action), Chalice (when you cast a healing spell, restore 1d8 + WIS to another creature within 30 feet), or Dragon (treat any roll of 9 or lower on Intelligence/Wisdom checks and Constitution saves as a 10).

features.name: Cosmic Omen
features.description: Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can consult your Star Map and roll a die. If the result is even (Weal), you can use a Reaction to add 1d6 to a creature's attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. If odd (Woe), you can subtract 1d6 from such a roll. You can use this a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

features.name: Twinkling Constellations
features.description: The constellations of your Starry Form improve. The Archer and Chalice dice become 2d8. In Dragon form, you also gain a Fly Speed of 20 feet and can hover. You can change which constellation you're using at the start of each of your turns.

features.name: Full of Stars
features.description: While in your Starry Form, you become partially incorporeal, giving you Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

name: Battle Master
description: Those who emulate the Battle Master employ martial techniques passed down through generations. A Battle Master uses tactical maneuvers to gain the upper hand in combat, channeling their combat superiority through precision strikes and tactical gambits.

features.name: Combat Superiority
features.description: You learn three maneuvers of your choice from the list of Battle Master maneuvers. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You learn two additional maneuvers at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one. You gain four Superiority Dice, which are d8s. A Superiority Die is expended when you use it. You regain all expended Superiority Dice when you finish a Short or Long Rest. You gain an additional Superiority Die when you reach Fighter levels 7 (five dice total) and 15 (six dice total). If a maneuver requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) and Proficiency Bonus.

features.name: Student of War
features.description: You gain proficiency with one type of Artisan's Tools of your choice, and you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice from the skills available to Fighters at level 1.

features.name: Know Your Enemy
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can discern certain strengths and weaknesses of a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself; you know whether that creature has any Immunities, Resistances, or Vulnerabilities, and if the creature has any, you know what they are. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also restore a use of the feature by expending one Superiority Die (no action required).

features.name: Improved Combat Superiority
features.description: Your Superiority Die becomes a d10.

features.name: Relentless
features.description: Once per turn, when you use a maneuver, you can roll 1d8 and use the number rolled instead of expending a Superiority Die.

features.name: Ultimate Combat Superiority
features.description: Your Superiority Die becomes a d12.

name: Champion
description: A Champion focuses on the development of martial prowess in a relentless pursuit of victory. Champions combine superior athleticism with devastating strikes to overcome any challenge.

features.name: Improved Critical
features.description: Your attack rolls with weapons and Unarmed Strikes can score a Critical Hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

features.name: Remarkable Athlete
features.description: You have Advantage on Initiative rolls and Strength (Athletics) checks. In addition, immediately after you score a Critical Hit, you can move up to half your Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Additional Fighting Style
features.description: At 7th level, you can choose a second option from the Fighting Style feature.

features.name: Heroic Warrior
features.description: During combat, you can give yourself Heroic Inspiration whenever you start your turn without it.

features.name: Superior Critical
features.description: Your attack rolls with weapons and Unarmed Strikes can score a Critical Hit on a roll of 18, 19, or 20 on the d20.

features.name: Survivor
features.description: You attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle, gaining the following benefits. Defy Death: You have Advantage on Death Saving Throws. In addition, when you roll 18-20 on a Death Saving Throw, you gain the benefit of rolling a 20 on it. Heroic Rally: At the start of each of your turns, you regain Hit Points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you are Bloodied (at or below half your Hit Point maximum) and have at least 1 Hit Point.

name: Eldritch Knight
description: The Eldritch Knight combines martial prowess with the study of magic. These fighters learn to cast spells from the Wizard spell list, using Intelligence as their spellcasting ability. They weave magic and swordplay into a deadly combination.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast Wizard spells. You know two cantrips of your choice from the Wizard spell list. Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Wizard cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability.

features.name: War Bond
features.description: You learn a ritual that bonds you to up to two weapons. Once bonded, you can't be Disarmed of that weapon unless you are Incapacitated. If the bonded weapon is on the same plane of existence, you can summon it as a Bonus Action, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand.

features.name: War Magic
features.description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of the attacks with casting one of your cantrips that has a casting time of one action.

features.name: Eldritch Strike
features.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has Disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

features.name: Arcane Charge
features.description: When you use Action Surge, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can teleport before or after the additional action.

features.name: Improved War Magic
features.description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace two of the attacks with casting a 1st or 2nd level spell that has a casting time of one action.

name: Psi Warrior
description: Psi Warriors are fighters who augment their physical might with psi-infused weapon strikes, telekinetic lashes, and barriers of mental force. Many githyanki train to become Psi Warriors, as do some of the most disciplined warriors among other peoples.

features.name: Psionic Power
features.description: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy. Your Psionic Energy dice progress as follows: L3: 4×d6, L5: 6×d8, L9: 8×d8, L11: 8×d10, L13: 10×d10, L17: 12×d12. You can use them for: Protective Field (reduce damage to you or a creature within 30 feet by the die roll as a Reaction), Psionic Strike (add the die roll as Force damage to a weapon hit), or Telekinetic Movement (move a Large or smaller object or willing creature up to 30 feet as a Magic action).

features.name: Telekinetic Adept
features.description: You reach new heights with your psionic abilities. Psi-Powered Leap: As a Bonus Action, you gain a Fly Speed equal to twice your Speed until the end of the current turn. Telekinetic Thrust: When you deal damage with your Psionic Strike, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + Prof + Int mod). On a failure, you can push the target up to 10 feet or knock it Prone.

features.name: Guarded Mind
features.description: You have Resistance to Psychic damage. If you start your turn Charmed or Frightened, you can expend a Psionic Energy die and end every effect on yourself subjecting you to those conditions.

features.name: Bulwark of Force
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can choose creatures, which can include you, that you can see within 30 feet of you, up to a number equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one). Each chosen creature is protected by half cover for 1 minute or until you're Incapacitated. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest, unless you expend a Psionic Energy die to use it again.

features.name: Telekinetic Master
features.description: You always have the Telekinesis spell prepared. You can cast it without a spell slot or components, and you can make one weapon attack as a Bonus Action while concentrating on it. When you cast it this way, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest, unless you expend a Psionic Energy die to use it again.

name: Warrior of Mercy
description: Warriors of Mercy manipulate the life force of others to bring aid to those in need and deliver swift justice to those beyond redemption. They learn techniques of manipulating the ki of other creatures, granting them mastery over life and death.

features.name: Implements of Mercy
features.description: You gain proficiency in the Insight and Medicine skills, and you gain proficiency with the Herbalism Kit.

features.name: Hand of Healing
features.description: As a Magic action, you can spend 1 Focus Point and touch a creature to restore a number of Hit Points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the unarmed strikes with a use of this feature without spending a Focus Point.

features.name: Hand of Harm
features.description: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 Focus Point to deal extra Necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature only once per turn.

features.name: Physician's Touch
features.description: When you use Hand of Healing, you can also end one of the following conditions on the creature: Blinded, Deafened, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or Stunned. When you use Hand of Harm, you can subject the target to the Poisoned condition until the end of your next turn.

features.name: Flurry of Healing and Harm
features.description: When you use Flurry of Blows, you can replace each unarmed strike with a use of Hand of Healing without expending Focus Points. In addition, when you make an unarmed strike with Flurry of Blows, you can use Hand of Harm with that strike without spending a Focus Point. You can use Flurry of Healing and Harm a total number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Hand of Ultimate Mercy
features.description: As a Magic action, you can touch the corpse of a creature that died within the past 24 hours and expend 5 Focus Points. The creature then returns to life, regaining a number of Hit Points equal to 4d10 + your Wisdom modifier. If the creature had any of the following conditions when it died, they are removed: Blinded, Deafened, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or Stunned. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

name: Warrior of Shadow
description: Warriors of Shadow follow a tradition that values stealth and subterfuge. These monks might be called ninjas or shadowdancers, and they serve as spies and assassins. Sometimes members of these monasteries are family, forming clans sworn to secrecy about their arts.

features.name: Shadow Arts
features.description: You gain Darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet. You also learn the Minor Illusion cantrip (Shadowy Figments), using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. Additionally, you can spend 1 Focus Point to cast Darkness, creating a sphere of magical darkness. You can see within the spell's area. At the start of each of your turns, you can move the darkness area up to 60 feet.

features.name: Shadow Step
features.description: When you are in Dim Light or Darkness, as a Bonus Action you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in Dim Light or Darkness. You then have Advantage on the first melee attack you make before the end of the turn.

features.name: Improved Shadow Step
features.description: After using Shadow Step, you can spend 1 Focus Point to remove the dim light/darkness requirement. After teleporting with Shadow Step, you can immediately make one Unarmed Strike.

features.name: Cloak of Shadows
features.description: As a Magic action, you can spend 3 Focus Points to become Invisible for 1 minute while you are entirely within Dim Light or Darkness. For the duration, you are Partially Incorporeal: you can move through occupied spaces as if they were Difficult Terrain, and you gain Shadow Flurry, allowing you to use Flurry of Blows without spending Focus Points. The invisibility ends early if you have the Incapacitated condition or if you end your turn in Bright Light.

name: Warrior of the Elements
description: Warriors of the Elements channel the primordial forces of nature. They harness the elemental powers of air, earth, fire, and water, channeling these energies through their martial arts. Their strikes carry the fury of storms and the unyielding force of stone.

features.name: Elemental Attunement
features.description: At the start of your turn, you can spend 1 Focus Point to activate Elemental Attunement for 10 minutes or until you have the Incapacitated condition. For the duration, your reach with Unarmed Strikes increases by 10 feet. When you hit with your Unarmed Strike during Elemental Attunement, you choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder for the damage type. On a hit, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet toward or away from you.

features.name: Manipulate Elements
features.description: You know the Elementalism cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

features.name: Elemental Burst
features.description: As a Magic action, you can spend 2 Focus Points to create an elemental burst. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die. Choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder for the damage type. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

features.name: Stride of the Elements
features.description: While your Elemental Attunement is active, you gain a Fly Speed and a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

features.name: Elemental Epitome
features.description: While your Elemental Attunement is active, you gain the following benefits. Damage Resistance: You gain Resistance to a damage type of your choice from Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. You can change this choice at the start of each of your turns. Destructive Stride: When you use Step of the Wind, your Speed increases by 20 feet until the end of the turn, and each creature within 5 feet of you at any point during your move must make a Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die (element of your choice). A creature can take this damage only once per turn. Empowered Strikes: Once per turn when you hit with an Unarmed Strike, you deal extra damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die.

name: Warrior of the Open Hand
description: Warriors of the Open Hand are the ultimate masters of martial arts combat, whether armed or unarmed. They learn techniques to push and trip their opponents, manipulate ki to heal damage to their bodies, and practice advanced meditation that can protect them from harm.

features.name: Open Hand Technique
features.description: Whenever you hit a creature with an attack granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can impose one of the following effects. Addle: The target can't make Opportunity Attacks until the start of its next turn. Push: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from you. Topple: The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the Prone condition.

features.name: Wholeness of Body
features.description: At 6th level, you can use your Bonus Action to regain Hit Points equal to your Martial Arts die roll plus your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Fleet Step
features.description: When you take a Bonus Action other than Step of the Wind, you can also use Step of the Wind immediately after that Bonus Action.

features.name: Quivering Palm
features.description: You can spend 4 Focus Points to start imperceptible vibrations in a creature you hit with an Unarmed Strike. You can have only one creature under this effect at a time. The vibrations last for a number of days equal to your Monk level, and you can end them harmlessly without an action. To use this feature, you can forgo one of your attacks from the Attack action. While the vibrations are active, you can take a Magic action to end them, forcing the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 10d12 Force damage. On a success, the target takes half as much damage.

name: Oath of Devotion
description: The Oath of Devotion binds a paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order. Sometimes called cavaliers, white knights, or holy warriors, these paladins meet the ideal of the knight in shining armor, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good.

features.name: Oath Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Protection from Evil and Good, Shield of Faith; 5th level -- Aid, Zone of Truth; 9th level -- Beacon of Hope, Dispel Magic; 13th level -- Freedom of Movement, Guardian of Faith; 17th level -- Commune, Flame Strike.

features.name: Sacred Weapon
features.description: When you take the Attack action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to imbue one Melee weapon that you are holding with positive energy. For 10 minutes, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls made with that weapon (minimum bonus of +1), and you cause it to deal its normal damage type or Radiant damage (your choice each time you hit). The weapon also emits bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light 20 feet beyond that. You can end this effect early (no action required). This effect also ends if you aren't carrying the weapon.

features.name: Aura of Devotion
features.description: You and your allies have Immunity to the Charmed condition while in your Aura of Protection. If a Charmed ally enters the aura, that condition has no effect on that ally while there.

features.name: Smite of Protection
features.description: Whenever you cast Divine Smite, you and your allies have Half Cover while in your Aura of Protection. The aura has this benefit until the start of your next turn.

features.name: Holy Nimbus
features.description: At 20th level, as a Bonus Action, you can emanate an aura of sunlight. For 10 minutes, bright light shines from you in a 30-foot radius, and dim light shines 30 feet beyond that. Holy Ward: You have Advantage on saving throws against spells and effects of Fiends and Undead. Radiant Damage: Whenever an enemy creature starts its turn in the bright light, the creature takes Radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. Sunlight: The bright light counts as sunlight. You can also restore your use of this feature by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

name: Oath of Glory
description: Paladins who take the Oath of Glory believe they and their companions are destined to achieve glory through deeds of heroism. They train diligently and encourage their companions so they're all ready when destiny calls.

features.name: Oath Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Guiding Bolt, Heroism; 5th level -- Enhance Ability, Magic Weapon; 9th level -- Haste, Protection from Energy; 13th level -- Compulsion, Freedom of Movement; 17th level -- Legend Lore, Yolande's Regal Presence.

features.name: Peerless Athlete
features.description: As a Bonus Action using your Channel Divinity, you augment your athleticism for 1 hour. For the duration, you have Advantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks, you can carry, push, drag, and lift twice as much weight as normal, and the distance of your Long and High Jumps increases by 10 feet.

features.name: Inspiring Smite
features.description: Immediately after you cast Divine Smite, you can use your Channel Divinity to distribute Temporary Hit Points. You distribute a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to 2d8 + your Paladin level to creatures of your choice within 30 feet, which can include you.

features.name: Aura of Alacrity
features.description: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. In addition, whenever an ally starts their turn within 10 feet of you, that ally's walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of that turn.

features.name: Glorious Defense
features.description: When you or another creature you can see within 10 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can use your Reaction to add your Charisma modifier to the target's AC against that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss. If the attack misses, you can make one weapon attack against the attacker as part of this Reaction.

features.name: Living Legend
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you gain the following benefits for 10 minutes: you have Advantage on Charisma checks, once per turn when you miss with a weapon attack you can cause that attack to hit instead, and if you fail a saving throw you can use your Reaction to reroll it. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

name: Oath of the Ancients
description: The Oath of the Ancients is as old as the race of elves and the rituals of the druids. Sometimes called fey knights, green knights, or horned knights, paladins who swear this oath cast their lot with the side of the light in the cosmic struggle against darkness.

features.name: Oath Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Ensnaring Strike, Speak with Animals; 5th level -- Misty Step, Moonbeam; 9th level -- Plant Growth, Protection from Energy; 13th level -- Ice Storm, Stoneskin; 17th level -- Commune with Nature, Tree Stride.

features.name: Nature's Wrath
features.description: As a Magic action using your Channel Divinity, you can cause spectral vines to spring up and reach for a creature within 10 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice) or have the Restrained condition. While Restrained, the creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

features.name: Aura of Warding
features.description: You and your allies within your Aura of Protection have Resistance to damage from spells.

features.name: Undying Sentinel
features.description: When you are reduced to 0 HP and not killed outright, you are instead reduced to a number of HP equal to 3 times your Paladin level. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Elder Champion
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you assume the form of an ancient force of nature for 1 minute. You regain 10 Hit Points at the start of each of your turns, your Paladin spells that have a casting time of an Action can instead be cast as a Bonus Action, and enemies within 10 feet of you have Disadvantage on saving throws against your Paladin spells and Channel Divinity options.

name: Oath of Vengeance
description: The Oath of Vengeance is a solemn commitment to punish those who have committed a grievous sin. When evil forces slaughter helpless villagers, when a people turns against the will of the gods, when a thieves' guild grows too violent, a paladin of vengeance swears to set right that which has gone wrong.

features.name: Oath Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Bane, Hunter's Mark; 5th level -- Hold Person, Misty Step; 9th level -- Haste, Protection from Energy; 13th level -- Banishment, Dimension Door; 17th level -- Hold Monster, Scrying.

features.name: Vow of Enmity
features.description: When you take the Attack action, you can expend one use of Channel Divinity to utter a vow against a creature within 10 feet. You have Advantage on attack rolls against that creature for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 HP. When the target drops to 0 HP, you can transfer the vow to a different creature within 30 feet.

features.name: Relentless Avenger
features.description: When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, you can move up to half your speed immediately after the attack and as part of the same Reaction. This movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Soul of Vengeance
features.description: When a creature under the effect of your Vow of Enmity makes an attack, you can use your Reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature if it is within range.

features.name: Avenging Angel
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you gain the following benefits for 1 hour: wings sprout from your back giving you a Fly Speed of 60 feet, and you emanate a menacing aura in a 30-foot radius. Each hostile creature that starts its turn in the aura or enters it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be Frightened of you for 1 minute.

name: Beast Master
description: The Beast Master archetype embodies a friendship between the civilized races and the beasts of the world. A ranger who follows this path forms a mystical bond with a primal beast, creating a partnership that enhances both the ranger's and the beast's abilities in combat.

features.name: Primal Companion
features.description: You magically summon a primal beast, which draws strength from your bond with nature. Choose its form: Beast of the Land (40 ft speed, charging attack), Beast of the Sea (swim 60 ft, binding strike), or Beast of the Sky (fly 60 ft, shred). In combat, the beast acts during your turn. It can move and use its Reaction on its own, but takes the Dodge action unless you use a Bonus Action to command it to take another action.

features.name: Exceptional Training
features.description: When you command your beast companion to take the Attack action, it can make two attacks. The beast's attacks now count as magical for the purpose of overcoming Resistance and Immunity to nonmagical attacks.

features.name: Bestial Fury
features.description: When you command your beast to take the Attack action, you can also make one weapon attack yourself as part of the same Bonus Action used to command the beast.

features.name: Share Spells
features.description: When you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your beast companion with the spell if the beast is within 30 feet of you.

name: Fey Wanderer
description: A Fey Wanderer has a joyful yet eerie presence, bolstered by the blessings of the Feywild. You learned your magical abilities from experience with the fey realm and its denizens, and your mystical connection to nature gives you a supernatural charm.

features.name: Dreadful Strikes
features.description: You can augment your weapon strikes with mind-scarring magic drawn from the gloomy hollows of the Feywild. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon, you can deal an extra 1d4 Psychic damage. This extra damage increases to 1d6 at 11th level.

features.name: Fey Wanderer Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Charm Person; 5th level -- Misty Step; 9th level -- Summon Fey; 13th level -- Dimension Door; 17th level -- Mislead.

features.name: Otherworldly Glamour
features.description: You can add your Wisdom modifier to any Charisma check you make. You also gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Performance, or Persuasion.

features.name: Beguiling Twist
features.description: When a creature within 120 feet of you succeeds on a saving throw against being Charmed or Frightened, you can use your Reaction to force a different creature within 120 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is Charmed or Frightened by you (your choice) for 1 minute.

features.name: Fey Reinforcements
features.description: You can cast Summon Fey without a material component. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Misty Wanderer
features.description: You can cast Misty Step without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), regaining all uses on a Long Rest. Whenever you cast Misty Step, you can bring along one willing creature within 5 feet of you.

name: Gloom Stalker
description: Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places, wielding shadow magic to ambush their foes before they know what hit them. Many of these rangers venture into the Underdark, where they protect the surface world from subterranean threats.

features.name: Dread Ambusher
features.description: You can give yourself a bonus to your Initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier. At the start of your first turn of each combat, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of that turn. If you take the Attack action on that turn, you can make one additional weapon attack as part of that action. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra 2d6 Psychic damage. You can use this extra attack a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, and you regain all uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Gloom Stalker Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 3rd level -- Disguise Self; 5th level -- Rope Trick; 9th level -- Fear; 13th level -- Greater Invisibility; 17th level -- Seeming.

features.name: Umbral Sight
features.description: You gain Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet. You are also effectively invisible to any creature that relies on Darkvision to see you in that darkness.

features.name: Iron Mind
features.description: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

features.name: Stalker's Flurry
features.description: Once per turn when you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

features.name: Shadowy Dodge
features.description: When a creature makes an attack roll against you and doesn't have Advantage on the roll, you can use your Reaction to impose Disadvantage on it. You must use this feature before you know the outcome of the attack roll.

name: Hunter
description: Emulating the Hunter archetype means accepting your place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness. You learn specialized techniques for fighting the threats you face, from rampaging ogres and hordes of orcs to towering giants and terrifying dragons.

features.name: Hunter's Lore
features.description: While a creature is marked by your Hunter's Mark, you know whether the creature has any damage immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities, and if the creature has any, you know what they are.

features.name: Hunter's Prey
features.description: You gain one of the following features of your choice. Colossus Slayer: Your tenacity can wear down even the most resilient foes. When you hit a creature with a weapon, the weapon deals an extra 1d8 damage to the target if it's missing any of its Hit Points. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn. Horde Breaker: Once on each of your turns when you make an attack with a weapon, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target, that is within the weapon's range, and that you haven't attacked this turn. Whenever you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can replace the feature you chose with the other one.

features.name: Defensive Tactics
features.description: You gain one of the following features of your choice. Escape the Horde: Opportunity Attacks have Disadvantage against you. Multiattack Defense: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, that creature has Disadvantage on all other attack rolls against you this turn. Whenever you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can replace the feature you chose with the other one.

features.name: Superior Hunter's Prey
features.description: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature marked by your Hunter's Mark, you can also deal that spell's extra damage to a different creature that you can see within 30 feet of the first creature.

features.name: Superior Hunter's Defense
features.description: When you take damage, you can use a Reaction to give yourself Resistance to that damage and any other damage of the same type until the end of the current turn.

name: Arcane Trickster
description: Some rogues enhance their fine-honed skills of stealth and agility with magic, learning tricks of enchantment and illusion. These rogues include pickpockets and burglars, but also pranksters, mischief-makers, and a significant number of adventurers.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You augment your roguish abilities with the ability to cast Wizard spells. You learn three cantrips, including Mage Hand, and learn spells from the Wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability.

features.name: Mage Hand Legerdemain
features.description: When you cast Mage Hand, you can make the spectral hand invisible. You can perform additional tasks with it: stow or retrieve an object in a container worn or carried by another creature, use Thieves' Tools at range to pick locks and disarm traps. You can also use the Bonus Action granted by Cunning Action to control the hand.

features.name: Magical Ambush
features.description: If you are Hidden from a creature when you cast a spell on it, the creature has Disadvantage on any saving throw it makes against the spell on that turn.

features.name: Versatile Trickster
features.description: You gain the ability to distract targets with your Mage Hand. As a Bonus Action, you can designate a creature within 5 feet of your Mage Hand. You have Advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the end of the turn.

features.name: Spell Thief
features.description: Immediately after a creature casts a spell that targets you or includes you in its area of effect, you can use your Reaction to force the creature to make a saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, you negate the spell's effect against you and you steal knowledge of the spell if it is at least 1st level and of a level you can cast. For the next 8 hours, you know the spell and can cast it. The creature can't cast that spell until 8 hours have passed. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

name: Assassin
description: You focus your training on the grim art of death. Those who adhere to this archetype are diverse: hired killers, spies, bounty hunters, and even specially anointed priests trained to exterminate the enemies of their deity.

features.name: Assassinate
features.description: You are at your deadliest when you get the drop on your enemies. You have Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in the combat yet. Any hit you score against a Surprised creature is a Critical Hit.

features.name: Assassin's Tools
features.description: You gain a Disguise Kit and a Poisoner's Kit, and you have proficiency with them.

features.name: Infiltration Expertise
features.description: You can unfailingly create false identities for yourself. You must spend 25 gp and seven days of downtime to establish the history, profession, and affiliations for an identity. Thereafter, if you adopt the new identity as a disguise, other creatures believe you to be that person until given an obvious reason not to.

features.name: Envenom Weapons
features.description: When you deal Sneak Attack damage, you can change the damage type to Poison. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the Poisoned condition for 1 minute.

features.name: Death Strike
features.description: When you hit a creature that hasn't taken a turn yet in combat, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, double the damage of your attack against the creature.

name: Soulknife
description: A Soulknife strikes with the mind, cutting through barriers both physical and psychic. These rogues discover a mystical connection to psychic energy, manifesting blades of shimmering psychic power from their minds.

features.name: Psionic Power
features.description: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy. You have a number of Psionic Energy dice equal to twice your Proficiency Bonus, which are d6s. You can use them for: Psi-Bolstered Knack (add the die roll to a failed ability check to potentially succeed) or Psychic Whispers (establish telepathic communication with creatures equal to your Proficiency Bonus for a number of hours equal to the die roll).

features.name: Psychic Blades
features.description: You can manifest shimmering blades of psychic energy. When you take the Attack action, you can manifest a psychic blade from your hand and make a melee or ranged attack (range 60/120 ft). The blade deals 1d6 Psychic damage plus the ability modifier you used for the attack roll. The blades have the Vex mastery property. After attacking with the blade, you can make a melee or ranged attack with a second psychic blade as a Bonus Action, dealing 1d4 Psychic damage.

features.name: Soul Blades
features.description: You can use your Psionic Energy dice with your Psychic Blades. Homing Strikes: if you miss with a Psychic Blade, you can roll a Psionic Energy die and add it to the attack roll, potentially turning a miss into a hit. Psychic Teleportation: as a Bonus Action, manifest a Psychic Blade, roll a Psionic Energy die, and teleport up to the number of feet rolled times 10 to an unoccupied space you can see.

features.name: Psychic Veil
features.description: As a Magic action, you can become Invisible, along with anything you are wearing or carrying, for 1 hour or until you dismiss this effect. The Invisibility ends early if you deal damage or force a creature to make a saving throw. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest, unless you expend a Psionic Energy die to use it again.

features.name: Rend Mind
features.description: When you deal Sneak Attack damage to a creature with your Psychic Blades, you can force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Dexterity modifier). On a failure, the target has the Stunned condition for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

name: Thief
description: A mix of burglar, treasure hunter, and explorer, you are the epitome of an adventurer. In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you gain abilities useful for delving into ruins and getting maximum benefit from the magic items you find there.

features.name: Fast Hands
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can do one of the following. Sleight of Hand. Make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check to pick a lock or disarm a trap with Thieves' Tools or to pick a pocket. Use an Object. Take the Utilize action, or take the Magic action to use a magic item that requires that action.

features.name: Second-Story Work
features.description: You've trained to get into especially hard-to-reach places, granting you these benefits. Climber. You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed. Jumper. You can determine your jump distance using your Dexterity rather than your Strength.

features.name: Supreme Sneak
features.description: You gain the following Cunning Strike option. Stealth Attack (Cost: 1d6). If you have the Hide action's Invisible condition, this attack doesn't end that condition on you if you end the turn behind Three-Quarters Cover or Total Cover.

features.name: Use Magic Device
features.description: You've learned how to maximize use of magic items, granting you the following benefits. Attunement. You can attune to up to four magic items at once. Charges. Whenever you use a magic item property that expends charges, roll 1d6. On a roll of 6, you use the property without expending the charges. Scrolls. You can use any Spell Scroll, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability for the spell. If the spell is a cantrip or a level 1 spell, you can cast it reliably. If the scroll contains a higher-level spell, you must first succeed on an Intelligence (Arcana) check (DC 10 plus the spell's level). On a successful check, you cast the spell from the scroll. On a failed check, the scroll disintegrates.

features.name: Thief's Reflexes
features.description: You are adept at laying ambushes and quickly escaping danger. You can take two turns during the first round of any combat. You take your first turn at your normal Initiative and your second turn at your Initiative minus 10.

name: Aberrant Sorcery
description: An alien influence has wrapped its tendrils around your mind, giving you psionic power. You can now touch other minds with that power and alter the world around you by using it to control the magical energy of the multiverse. This power might arise from exposure to the Far Realm or contact with an aberrant entity.

features.name: Psionic Spells
features.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels, which don't count against the number of spells you know: 3rd level -- Arms of Hadar, Calm Emotions, Detect Thoughts, Dissonant Whispers; 5th level -- Hunger of Hadar, Sending; 7th level -- Evard's Black Tentacles, Summon Aberration; 9th level -- Rary's Telepathic Bond, Telekinesis.

features.name: Telepathic Speech
features.description: You can form a telepathic connection between your mind and the mind of another. As a Bonus Action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet. You and the chosen creature can speak telepathically with each other while the two of you are within a number of miles equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). This connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to your Sorcerer level.

features.name: Psionic Sorcery
features.description: When you cast any spell from your Psionic Spells feature, you can cast it by expending a number of Sorcery Points equal to the spell's level instead of expending a spell slot. If you cast a spell this way, it requires no Verbal or Somatic components, and it requires no Material components unless they are consumed by the spell.

features.name: Psychic Defenses
features.description: You gain Resistance to Psychic damage. You also have Advantage on saving throws against the Charmed and Frightened conditions.

features.name: Revelation in Flesh
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can spend 1 or more Sorcery Points to transform your body for 10 minutes. For each Sorcery Point spent, choose one benefit: see any Invisible creature within 60 feet, gain a Fly Speed equal to your Walking Speed and hover, gain a Swim Speed equal to twice your Walking Speed and breathe underwater, or become slimy and pliable, moving through spaces as narrow as 1 inch without Squeezing.

features.name: Warping Implosion
features.description: As a Magic action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet. Immediately after you disappear, each creature within 30 feet of the space you left must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 3d10 Force damage and is pulled in a straight line to the space you left. On a success, a creature takes half damage and isn't pulled. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest, unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points to use it again.

name: Clockwork Sorcery
description: The cosmic force of order has suffused you with magic. That power arises from Mechanus or a realm like it -- a plane of existence shaped entirely by clockwork efficiency. You or someone in your lineage might have become combated with the modrons or other creatures of absolute law.

features.name: Clockwork Spells
features.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels, which don't count against the number of spells you know: 3rd level -- Aid, Alarm, Lesser Restoration, Protection from Evil and Good; 5th level -- Dispel Magic, Protection from Energy; 7th level -- Freedom of Movement, Summon Construct; 9th level -- Greater Restoration, Wall of Force.

features.name: Restore Balance
features.description: Your connection to the plane of absolute order allows you to equalize chaotic moments. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you is about to roll a d20 with Advantage or Disadvantage, you can use your Reaction to prevent the roll from being affected by Advantage or Disadvantage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Bastion of Law
features.description: As a Magic action, you can spend 1 to 5 Sorcery Points to create a magical ward around yourself or another creature you can see within 30 feet. The ward is represented by a number of d8s equal to the Sorcery Points spent. When the warded creature takes damage, it can expend a number of those dice, roll them, and reduce the damage taken by the total rolled.

features.name: Trance of Order
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can enter a state of clockwork consciousness for 1 minute. For the duration, attack rolls against you can't benefit from Advantage, and whenever you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest, unless you spend 7 Sorcery Points to use it again.

features.name: Clockwork Cavalcade
features.description: As a Magic action, you summon spirits of order that restore the natural order of things in a 30-foot cube originating from you. The spirits remove disease, end the Charmed, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, and Stunned conditions from each creature of your choice in the cube, and each creature you choose regains 100 Hit Points. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

name: Draconic Sorcery
description: Your innate magic comes from the gift of a dragon. Perhaps an ancient dragon blessed your birth or chose to bestow magic upon you. Whatever the case, draconic power flows through you and yearns to be given expression through your spells.

features.name: Draconic Resilience
features.description: The magic flowing through your body causes physical traits of your dragon ancestors to emerge. Your Hit Point maximum increases by 3, and increases by 1 whenever you gain a Sorcerer level. Parts of your skin are covered by a thin sheen of dragon-like scales. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

features.name: Draconic Spells
features.description: Whenever you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Draconic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared: 3rd -- Alter Self, Chromatic Orb, Command, Dragon's Breath; 5th -- Fear, Fly; 7th -- Arcane Eye, Charm Monster; 9th -- Legend Lore, Summon Dragon. These don't count against the number of spells you can prepare.

features.name: Elemental Affinity
features.description: Choose one damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. You gain Resistance to that damage type. In addition, when you cast a spell that deals damage of that type, you can add your Charisma modifier to one damage roll of that spell.

features.name: Dragon Wings
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can manifest spectral dragon wings from your back. While the wings are present, you have a Fly Speed of 60 feet. The wings last for 1 hour or until you dismiss them (no action required). You can use this feature once per Long Rest, or you can expend 3 Sorcery Points to use it again.

features.name: Dragon Companion
features.description: You can cast Summon Dragon without a Material component. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a Long Rest. Whenever you start casting the spell, you can modify it so that it doesn't require Concentration. If you do so, the spell's duration becomes 1 minute for that casting.

name: Wild Magic Sorcery
description: Your innate magic comes from the wild forces of chaos that underlie the order of creation. You might have endured exposure to some form of raw magic, perhaps through a planar portal leading to Limbo or the Elemental Planes. Whatever its origin, this chaotic magic churns within you, waiting for any outlet.

features.name: Wild Magic Surge
features.description: Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. Once per turn, the DM can have you roll a d20 immediately after you cast a Sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a magical effect.

features.name: Tides of Chaos
features.description: You can manipulate the forces of chance and chaos to gain Advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you do so, you must finish a Long Rest before you can use this feature again. Any time before you regain the use of this feature, the DM can have you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table immediately after you cast a Sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. You then regain the use of this feature.

features.name: Bend Luck
features.description: You have the ability to twist fate using your wild magic.
